p: The lack of national and international investment in viral hepatitis programmes, especially in low- and middle-income countries, means that national hepatitis programmes are underfunded. As a result, testing programmes are hampered and only small numbers of individuals therefore have access to treatment [6]. In order to establish a strong hepatitis response and strengthen healthcare systems, especially in low- and middle-income countries, financial support is needed to lay the groundwork for elimination by providing essential research and support [6].
